thread.title: SBS Documentary 'NEW OLD BOY' Explores Park ChanWook's Journey
thread.title_full: SBS Documentary 'NEW OLD BOY' Explores Park ChanWook's Journey

author: Nova
title: SBS Documentary 'NEW OLD BOY' Explores Park ChanWook's Journey
text:
Park ChanWook Documentary Airs on October 9, 2025 The highly anticipated SBS documentary “NEW OLD BOY (뉴 올드보이) 박찬욱” Part 2 aired on October 9, 2025. This insightful documentary delves into the life and career of acclaimed director Park ChanWook, showcasing how he transformed from an introverted individual into a globally recognized filmmaker.
Insights from Star-Studded Cast The documentary features a remarkable lineup of actors who have collaborated with Park ChanWook throughout his career, including Choi Minshik, Song Kangho, Lee Byunghun, Lee Youngae, Shin Hakyun, Son Yejin, Tang Wei, Lee Sungmin, Yeom Hyeran, Park Jungmin, Kim Haesook, and Kim Byeongok. Each actor shares personal anecdotes that illustrate Park’s unique directing philosophy and his meticulous approach to filmmaking.
Lee Youngae’s Experience Lee Youngae, known for her iconic role in “Dae Jang Geum,” discusses her struggles to immerse herself in roles after the show’s success. She reflects on how Park ChanWook’s guidance and support helped her navigate this challenging phase in her career.
Tang Wei’s Filming Journey Tang Wei recalls her experience working on “Decision to Leave,” where Park ChanWook’s recordings of dialogue proved invaluable during the filming process. Her account offers a glimpse into the collaborative atmosphere that Park fosters on set, emphasizing his commitment to helping actors perform at their best.
The Impact of Park ChanWook’s Work The documentary offers an in-depth look at Park ChanWook’s creative process, illustrating his principles and the rigorous revision process he employs. It highlights the significant impact he has had on his collaborators and the film industry, showcasing testimonials that speak to his artistry and dedication.
As the documentary continues to resonate with audiences, it reinforces Park ChanWook’s status as a pivotal figure in the K-drama and film landscape. By sharing these personal stories, the documentary not only celebrates his achievements but also inspires future generations of filmmakers and actors alike.
